name: Chicken Oscar
description: Bring fine dining to the comfort of your own home! “Steak Oscar” is a high-end, surf-n’-turf steakhouse dish, but our summery twist features grilled chicken—a leaner protein than the traditional beef tenderloin—for a simple yet elegant meal that anyone can prepare. Rich, tangy Béarnaise sauce solidifies this dish as a total crowd pleaser!

ingredients.name: Montreal Steak Rub or Beef & Steak Seasoning
raw, peeled jumbo prawns or shrimp, about 4

preparation: Preheat grill to medium-high heat. Lightly brush with oil.

To thinly slice chicken, place one hand on one breast and press down firmly. Curve fingers up slightly for safety. Carefully slice meat horizontally. Repeat with remaining chicken. You should have four pieces in total. Place in a bowl and toss with 1 tbsp rub and 1 tbsp oil.

Place beans and prawns in another large bowl; toss with remaining rub and oil. Lay out one, 12" piece of foil on the counter and place beans and prawns in the centre. Cover with a 6" piece of foil and roll up edges from the bottom to seal and form a packet.
Place chicken and foil packet on grill. Cook, with lid closed, 3–4 min per side, or until the chicken is cooked through. Don’t turn foil packet over.
To serve, divide beans between 4 plates, top each with chicken and prawn, and drizzle with 2 tbsp sauce.
tips: Prepare Béarnaise Sauce the night before.  Reheat in the microwave until warm, whisking every 30 seconds.
perfectlyBalanceYourPlate: Serve with 1 cup grilled potato wedges or mashed potatoes.

products.name: Beef & Steak Seasoning
summary: An all-purpose blend with mild heat & aromatic flavour.

products.name: Montreal Steak Rub
summary: Make it a steak night! Generously rub this low sodium blend on steak to create a beautiful, caramelized crust – or mix it with equal parts oil for a peppery marinade.

products.name: Hollandaise Sauce Mix (3pk)
summary: A healthier & lighter alternative to hollandaise sauce—skip the mess & complicated steps with this no-fail recipe.
